channel.title: How to use Freenode IRC from Whonix Workstation?
channel.description:
Is it possible at all? Is there a HOWTO in the wiki?
I mean the full scenario from anonymously registering an user over Tor then connecting to Freenode IRC over tor as well.

item.title: How to use Freenode IRC from Whonix Workstation?
item.dc:creator: tatertot
item.description:
tatertot:

As far as I know, nick registration requires a one-time clearnet connection to freenode.

Actually, it should be possible to register a freenode nick by opening a matrix chat with @freenode_NickServ:matrix.org. So no clearnet connection would be needed.

Read full topic
item.source: How to use Freenode IRC from Whonix Workstation?

item.title: How to use Freenode IRC from Whonix Workstation?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Yes. Not easy. You somehow need an extra tunnel ( https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tunnels/Introduction ) ( User -> Tor -> proxy/VPN/SSH -> Internet) for registration.

Read full topic
item.source: How to use Freenode IRC from Whonix Workstation?

item.title: How to use Freenode IRC from Whonix Workstation?
item.dc:creator: tatertot
item.description:
As far as I know, nick registration requires a one-time clearnet connection to freenode.

Subsequent connections can be done through tor via the matrix/freenode bridge (you <–tor–> riot.im/app <–> freenode ).

Read full topic
item.source: How to use Freenode IRC from Whonix Workstation?
